page.title: 01Bletchley,Milton Keynes
page.content: A5 Watling Street is the Roman Road which runs through the middle of our area.It goes under thew main railway line which is the London to Birmingham line.The dual carriageway diversion was built because the old A5 had too many traffic jams. In the North of our area are the estates of Coffee Hall,Beanhill, Netherfield and Tinkersbridge which were built 10 years ago by the Milton Keynes Development Corporation.Emerson Valley and Furzton are the newest estates which are in the North of the area.There are the older ones which are in West Bletchley. The Milton Keynes Bowl is a large bowl shaped area which can hold 50,000 people.Pop Concerts and American Football are held there.There is a lake called Mount Farm in our area and a greyhound and speedway stadium.
